Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Human Talent Management
headline: This free online management course shows you how to acquire and retain qualified personnel who can meet your needs.
description: This free online course explains how talent management can find people with high professional potential and maximize it. We show you how it fits into the human resources (HR) model and is driven by effective leadership. The course explores the differences between acquiring and managing talent and human resources to help you gain the ability to find good people and bring out their best in the workplace.

courseDescription:
Do you want the best people working for you? This course highlights the importance of managing ability and performance as you master the process of finding and developing new employees for your company or organization. Talent management focuses on highlighting those people with the potential to excel in their job. We begin by identifying the different types of employees and demonstrating how you can usefully categorize your colleagues. Managers need to develop workers with exceptional talents, skills and attitudes to maximize team performance and this course teaches you how.

In the second part of the course, we demonstrate how to correctly identify talent. This includes attention to the role that skill-based compensation can play in motivating people. We examine different roles played by managers and various leadership models, including Fiedler’s Contingency and the Hersey-Blanchard approach, to help you develop your own people- and production-oriented leadership style. We show you how roles, capabilities and people make up the ‘talent DNA’ as management combines all three. We then explain how to improve decision-making skills to increase performance and how to move beyond strategic HR to talent management - thus making your employees more efficient through capacity development.

Finally, we study the nurturing of future leaders through the creation of a healthy organizational culture. Many of the world's large companies carry out this practice through the acquisition and management of human talent. We demonstrate how to do this through financial strategies, marketing endeavours, HR programmes, information technology measures and operational plans. Talent management has become even more important due to the growing recognition that it helps drive business performance. Do you want to know how to boost output by creating a work climate where trust, motivation and respect are common attitudes? We show you that good talent management is not fragmented but consists of comprehensive development programmes that allow you to identify the potential within your employees. This course is aimed at those working in HR, managers and anyone who wants to bring out the best in their colleagues. Human capital is a crucial resource so learn how to make the most out of the people around you with this free online management course.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to what human talent is made of. You will also study the key processes that makeup talent management and the importance of these processes for the organizational culture. You will learn the phases that make up the transformational dimensions of human talent management in companies will be presented in detail.
topics: Talent Management and Acquisition - Learning Outcomes
Talent Management and Acquisition - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will be introduced to the best practices are for conducting corporate evaluations. This will include talent management and how to integrate the elements of talent management into a comprehensive system. You will learn about competency models for employees. Finally, you will study the process of nurturing the leaders of tomorrow.

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Define the types of employees that exist.
    • Compare different types of employees.
    • Describe the differences between human resource management and talent acquisition and management.
    • Analyze how the identification of human talent is carried out.
    • Describe the functions of the human resources department.
    • Outline the talent management process.
    • Discuss the components that make up human talent.
    • Explain the evolution of the human resources department over time.

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from the module are:
    • Employees who have high performance and high potential are called star employees, they are called talented employees.
    • The organization will grow based on its talent pool. This is why there is a difference between human resource management and talent acquisition and management. Every employee is covered by workforce planning, as long as we talk about talent identification, human capital will be strong. 
    • The leadership of talented and production-oriented people is a different style than your ordinary leadership models.
    • Business and professional skills have a profit share. They are the human factors that you have to demonstrate in your workplace.
    • For the different skill models, you have to play different roles. Therefore, there may be role conflict between job, project roles, and project roles during a particular period.
    • The DNA of talent will be roles, capacity development and people. An analyst will convert that information into knowledge which is a decision-making skill.
    • The learning and development department will be part of the strategic human resources using its workforce in the best way and with the best performance.
    • Talent management is a set of processes that allows a company to increase the value that its human capital contributes. Human capital on the one hand is intellectual capital, organizational capital in three parts, human capital and structural capital.
    • Human capital is those employees with the greatest potential and high-performing stars. The way employees contribute to an organization creates human capital.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Explain what the best practices are for conducting corporate evaluations.
    • Define what is talent management.
    • Analyze how to integrate the elements of talent management in a comprehensive system.
    • Describe how to build competency models for employees.
    • Discuss the process of nurturing the leaders of tomorrow.
    • Explain what the talent acquisition process consists of.
    • Explain how to identify a critical talent.
    • Indicate the importance of identifying leaders in companies.
    • Recognize the growing importance of talent acquisition within the organizational culture.

  • Talent Management Benchmarking Practices

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module are:
    • In our previous sessions, we have seen how to identify talent and then the different dimensions of talent management. And this definition will vary from organization to organization. So when we talk about talent management for this type of industry, we will say that those who are highly qualified will be talented employees.
    • The separation of talents must be done, and with honour, so that if the organization requires it in the future, the talent returns well or the organization invites. So all these parameters will create a highly valued talent. So there is a talent ranking.
    • You understand the positioning of the organization, the new organization, and the old organization, and therefore, you can control that mechanism from the lowest to the moderate rated system. So when you talk about new product development, when you talk about research, the employees are the ones doing the research. So the low-rated talents, the moderately-rated talents, and the high-rated talents are there.
    • Those who are creating the new job by designing themselves exemplify highly valued talent. Whenever we talk about benchmarking practices, it is organizational culture. This dimension is from the culture of the organization, and the culture of the organization flows from the top down and, therefore, in that case, getting the CEOs and senior executives to commit to the work of talent management.
    • So if the organization's leaders are alert and want to focus on talented employees, that engagement will lead to talent management practices and that will make an organization more successful. A model of competence is normally KSA, knowledge, skill and attitude.
    • If you are a good analyst, if you are a good business developer, then you are under the model of talented competencies. A person will learn fast, that is true, but someone has to tell him what to learn and how to learn and how to use that learning. So that learning process that is for training and performance support is there. Developing the skills and is called training.
